attributes.action: Stop Andy Burnham imposing extra funding for Greater Manchester police.
attributes.additional_details: Costs like this should not be forced onto council tax payers and councils should be brought to task on there own failings.
attributes.background: Council tax payers already pay for policing in Greater Manchester yet the City Mayor wants to add an extra £10 to each household to cover the cost of the police force failing to operate competently.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about changes to local council tax are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
